Class Budget

java.lang.Object
models.Budget
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Budget extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a budget for a specific category in the Flossy Personal Finance Manager system. Tracks the budgeted amount, spent amount, recurrence, and provides analysis.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Budget

      public Budget(String category, double amount, int recurrence)
      Constructs a new Budget with the given category, amount, and recurrence.
      Parameters:
      category - The budget category
      amount - The budgeted amount
      recurrence - The recurrence period in days (0 for one-time)

    • Budget

      public Budget(String category, double amount)
      Constructs a new one-time Budget with the given category and amount.
      Parameters:
      category - The budget category
      amount - The budgeted amount

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public UUID getId()
      Gets the unique identifier for this budget.
      Returns:
      The UUID of the budget

    • getNextDate

      public LocalDate getNextDate()
      Gets the next date for this budget period.
      Returns:
      The next date as a LocalDate

    • nextPeriod

      public void nextPeriod()
      Advances the budget to the next period (if recurring).

    • isOneTime

      public boolean isOneTime()
      Returns true if this is a one-time budget.
      Returns:
      True if one-time, false if recurring

    • addSpending

      public void addSpending(double amount)
      Adds spending to the spent amount for this period.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to add

    • resetSpentAmount

      public void resetSpentAmount()
      Resets the spent amount to zero for a new period.

    • isExceeded

      public boolean isExceeded()
      Returns true if the spent amount exceeds the budgeted amount.
      Returns:
      True if exceeded, false otherwise

    • getAnalysis

      public String getAnalysis()
      Returns a summary analysis of the budget status.
      Returns:
      A string summary of the budget
